Class Song

java.lang.Object
  Song

public class Song
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the full song as a master track. Each index at the track contains all the notes to be played at a specific time, which can be referenced by checking the index.

Author:
captainrobby37 4.19.2010

Method Detail

addEvent

public void addEvent(int midichannel,
                     int note,
                     int time)
Adds tunes to their respective index in the MASTER_TRACK

Parameters:
midichannel - Designates the MidiChannel for the tune
note - The MIDI note message, decides pitch.
time - Determines what time the note is to occur, based on what index it is placed at in the track array

songInit

public void songInit()
This method puts silent notes in the MASTER_TRACK, at each index. Therefore, when there are no notes at the current time, the onTick method can still add notes without getting out of bounds exceptions. The process of adding a note at every tick, without searching for a note first, reduces the amount of work the computer has to do, and allows for better playback when there are a lot of notes to be played.

getNotes

public java.util.ArrayList<tunes.Tune> getNotes(int time)
When called, this method returns the ArrayList. at the given index.

Parameters:
time - Index from which to receive the notes
Returns:
the Iterable of notes that happen at the given tick time
